content: So I think that the blog post draft is getting close to ready. The point of the post is to motivate the vision doc and to put out a call for people to write their own contributions.
I'd love feedback.
I'm also preparing a PR to the vision doc repo to clean it up, update some of the character bios and things
I feel like we're running ever so slightly behind schedule, but not too badly -- I had hoped to find owners for all the characters this week, which I guess could still happen :)
Nice, I just hope it's not too long to fit within the average attention span.
Yeah, that's a risk.
On the other hand, maybe the most important thing for the majority of people to read is the first two paragraphs--what we are going and why
I opened this up on blog.rust-lang.org: https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/793
@tmandry take a look :point_up: and let me know if you are happy
one thing I'm wondering is if "network applications and services" is actually inclusive enough
e.g., we use async/await for IPC on Fuchsia
I don't think it needs representation in a user story per se (though there are some interesting technical questions, they mostly revolve around executor APIs and integration with the OS)
I'm tempted to say "distributed systems" since that can be applied to just about anything
@tmandry interesting point
the other thing is that async is used for other kinds of "interruptible" things
GUIs come up a lot
yeah
I guess one could argue that this is still a distributed system; in this case, between the software, HID, and the user's brain ;)
I'm mostly kidding though, that's quite a stretch
of course do have to draw a line somewhere around the use cases we want to focus on
I still think networking is a bit too narrow, since I expect async I/O to become more of a thing once major executors add io-uring support
